articles.headline: Telemundo, Presidential Debate Under Its Belt, Moves Into 2020 Spotlight
articles.snippet: Expanded political coverage, and a new $250 million campus worthy of a start-up, are signs of a Spanish-language network on the rise.
articles.abstract: Expanded political coverage, and a new $250 million campus worthy of a start-up, are signs of a Spanish-language network on the rise.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Twenty miles west of Miami’s glittering oceanfront, closer to the Everglades than to the Fontainebleau hotel, a hangar-size office building rises from the flatlands like a spaceship.

articles.headline: With Flyovers and Flags, Trump Plays M.C. for the Fourth
articles.snippet: The president began with a rare call for unity in his 45-minute speech, but mostly spent time recounting the history of the armed forces, planes punctuating his message.
articles.abstract: The president began with a rare call for unity in his 45-minute speech, but mostly spent time recounting the history of the armed forces, planes punctuating his message.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a made-for-television Independence Day production starring America’s military weaponry, President Trump on Thursday used the Lincoln Memorial as the backdrop for a tribute to the country’s armed forces and a call for unity that has been largely absent during his divisive presidency.

articles.headline: It’s Not Just the White House in 2020. The Power to Draw Maps Is Also at Stake.
articles.snippet: With the nation’s political maps hanging in the balance, Democrats are racing to win back statehouse chambers and Republicans are rushing to defend gains from 2010.
articles.abstract: With the nation’s political maps hanging in the balance, Democrats are racing to win back statehouse chambers and Republicans are rushing to defend gains from 2010.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALLAS — Only hours after the United States Supreme Court said it could do nothing to stop partisan gerrymandering of the nation’s political maps, Eric H. Holder Jr. had a message for his fellow Democrats in downtown Dallas.
articles.byline: By Mitch Smith and Timothy Williams

articles.headline: NATO Considers Missile Defense Upgrade, Risking Further Tensions With Russia
articles.snippet: Some alliance officials think the move is needed to counter Russia’s new cruise missiles, but it could be “a point of no return with the Russians,” one expert said.
articles.abstract: Some alliance officials think the move is needed to counter Russia’s new cruise missiles, but it could be “a point of no return with the Russians,” one expert said.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — NATO military officials are exploring whether to upgrade their defenses to make them capable of shooting down newly deployed Russian intermediate-range nuclear missiles after a landmark arms treaty dissolves next month, according to three European officials.

articles.headline: Strong Jobs Report Eases Fears of Damage From Trade War
articles.snippet: President Trump declares that the economy is doing “unbelievably well” after payrolls grow by 224,000 in June.
articles.abstract: President Trump declares that the economy is doing “unbelievably well” after payrolls grow by 224,000 in June.
articles.lead_paragraph: A decade after the Great Recession released its grip on the American economy, the job market shows no sign of falling into another slump.

articles.headline: Israel’s Energy Dilemma: More Natural Gas Than It Can Use or Export
articles.snippet: After years of relying on imports, the country has discovered huge gas reserves offshore. But it cannot easily use or sell the fuel to other countries.
articles.abstract: After years of relying on imports, the country has discovered huge gas reserves offshore. But it cannot easily use or sell the fuel to other countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV — For decades, Israel was an energy-starved country surrounded by hostile, oil-rich neighbors.
